t: Galatians 1
Paul,*p an apostle, (not of men, neither by man, but by Jesus Christ, and God the Father, who raised him from the dead;)
And*p all the brethren which are with me, unto the churches of Galatia:
Grace*p be to you and peace from God the Father, and from our Lord Jesus Christ,
Who*p gave himself for our sins, that he might deliver us from this present evil world, according to the will of God and our Father:
To*p whom be glory for ever and ever. Amen.
I*p marvel that ye are so soon removed from him that called you into the grace of Christ unto another gospel:
Which*p is not another; but there be some that trouble you, and would pervert the gospel of Christ.
But*p though we, or an angel from heaven, preach any other gospel unto you than that which we have preached unto you, let him be accursed.
As*p we said before, so say I now again, If any man preach any other gospel unto you than that ye have received, let him be accursed.
For*p do I now persuade men, or God? or do I seek to please men? for if I yet pleased men, I should not be the servant of Christ.
But*p I certify you, brethren, that the gospel which was preached of me is not after man.
For*p I neither received it of man, neither was I taught it, but by the revelation of Jesus Christ.
For*p ye have heard of my conversation in time past in the Jews' religion, how that beyond measure I persecuted the church of God, and wasted it:
And*p profited in the Jews' religion above many my equals in mine own nation, being more exceedingly zealous of the traditions of my fathers.
But*p when it pleased God, who separated me from my mother's womb, and called me by his grace,
To*p reveal his Son in me, that I might preach him among the heathen; immediately I conferred not with flesh and blood:
Neither*p went I up to Jerusalem to them which were apostles before me; but I went into Arabia, and returned again unto Damascus.
Then*p after three years I went up to Jerusalem to see Peter, and abode with him fifteen days.
But*p other of the apostles saw I none, save James the Lord's brother.
Now*p the things which I write unto you, behold, before God, I lie not.
Afterwards*p I came into the regions of Syria and Cilicia;
And*p was unknown by face unto the churches of Judaea which were in Christ:
But*p they had heard only, That he which persecuted us in times past now preacheth the faith which once he destroyed.
And*p they glorified God in me.
